intro: Sida itaparicana, commonly known as Brazilian sida, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, alternate leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida itaparicana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
